story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Mexico, there was a young boy named José. José was a kind and curious boy who loved to explore the world around him. He spent his days playing in the fields and forests near his home, discovering new things and making friends with the animals that lived there.

One day, while José was out exploring, he came across a beautiful bird with feathers as bright as the sun. The bird was perched on a branch, singing a sweet and melodious song. José was enchanted by the bird's beauty and song, and he watched it for a long time.

As he was watching, the bird suddenly flew down and landed on José's shoulder. José was surprised, but he didn't move a muscle, afraid of scaring the bird away. The bird sang a few more notes, then flew back up to its branch.

José couldn't believe what had just happened. He watched the bird for a while longer, then decided to follow it. He crept quietly through the forest, trying not to make a sound, and the bird led him deeper and deeper into the woods.

Finally, they came to a clearing, and in the center of the clearing was a magnificent tree, taller and wider than any José had ever seen. The bird flew up to a branch near the top of the tree and sang again, and this time, the tree began to glow with a soft, golden light.

José was amazed. He had never seen anything like it before. He watched as the tree continued to glow, and then, suddenly, a door appeared in the trunk of the tree. The bird flew through the door, and José followed.

On the other side of the door was a beautiful garden, filled with flowers and trees and birds of every color. José couldn't believe his eyes. He had never seen anything so beautiful in his entire life.

The bird led José to a small pond in the center of the garden, and there, José saw the most wondrous sight of all: a tiny village, inhabited by the smallest people he had ever seen. They were no bigger than his thumb, and they lived in houses made of leaves and flowers.

The bird explained to José that these were the magical people of the forest, and they had been waiting for him. They welcomed José with open arms and invited him to stay with them for a while.

José was overjoyed. He spent his days playing with the magical people and exploring the beautiful garden. He learned how to fly with the birds and how to talk to the animals. He was happy beyond his wildest dreams.

But eventually, it was time for José to return home. The magical people and the bird saw him off with tears in their eyes, and José promised to come back and visit them again someday.

And he did. Every year, on the same day, José would return to the forest and visit his friends. He would spend the day playing and laughing and exploring, and then, when the sun began to set, he would say goodbye and return to his village.

And that is the story of how José became friends with the magical people of the forest. From that day on, he always had a special place in his heart for the beauty and wonder of the natural world.

Now, my son, it is time for you to close your eyes and dream of your own magical adventures. Goodnight.
